org.apache.flink.api.java

Class LocalEnvironment

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.api.java.ExecutionEnvironment
      • org.apache.flink.api.java.LocalEnvironment

  • public class LocalEnvironment
extends ExecutionEnvironment
    An ExecutionEnvironment that runs the program locally, multi-threaded, in the JVM where the environment is instantiated. When this environment is instantiated, it uses a default degree of parallelism of 1. Local environments can also be instantiated through ExecutionEnvironment.createLocalEnvironment() and ExecutionEnvironment.createLocalEnvironment(int). The former version will pick a default degree of parallelism equal to the number of hardware contexts in the local machine.

      Creates a new local environment.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public org.apache.flink.api.common.JobExecutionResult execute(String jobName)
                                                       throws Exception
        Description copied from class: ExecutionEnvironment
        Triggers the program execution. The environment will execute all parts of the program that have resulted in a "sink" operation. Sink operations are for example printing results (DataSet.print(), writing results (e.g. DataSet.writeAsText(String), DataSet.write(org.apache.flink.api.common.io.FileOutputFormat, String), or other generic data sinks created with DataSet.output(org.apache.flink.api.common.io.OutputFormat).

        The program execution will be logged and displayed with the given job name.

        Specified by:
        execute in class ExecutionEnvironment
        Returns:
        The result of the job execution, containing elapsed time and accumulators.
        Throws:
        Exception - Thrown, if the program executions fails.

      • getExecutionPlan

        public String getExecutionPlan()
                        throws Exception
        Description copied from class: ExecutionEnvironment
        Creates the plan with which the system will execute the program, and returns it as a String using a JSON representation of the execution data flow graph.
        Specified by:
        getExecutionPlan in class ExecutionEnvironment
        Returns:
        The execution plan of the program, as a JSON String.
        Throws:
        Exception - Thrown, if the compiler could not be instantiated, or the master could not be contacted to retrieve information relevant to the execution planning.

      • enableLogging

        public void enableLogging()
        Causes the local environment to print INFO level log messages to the standard error output.

      • disableLogging

        public void disableLogging()
        Completely disables logging during the execution of programs in the local environment.

      • isLoggingEnabled

        public boolean isLoggingEnabled()
        Checks whether logging during the program execution is enabled or disabled.

        By default, logging is turned off.

        Returns:
        True, if logging is enabled, false otherwise.
